comments:
Cannot launch remote manual test suites through VPN connection.

Despite disabling the firewalls on both sides, launching a remote manual test 
suites through VPN connection causing the local workbench to generate the error 
cited in https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=112780.

P2 Highly desirable and planned for this release, but not stop ship 
normal A problem making a function difficult to use but no special work around 
is required

This is only a problem when specifying the host name.  Using the IP address of 
the host in the location artifact works.

This defect seems to be specific to the reporter's specific machine since other 
TPTP committers are able to launch manual tests on the target machine with both 
the host name and IP address.  Returning as 'works for me' until we see this 
symptom again.

This defect is reoccurring, albeit sporadically, with both manual and JUnit 
test suites.  Interestingly, the problem seems to be seen more when connecting 
from home over my wireless network.  Here are the exceptions from running the 
enclosed test suites using the TPTP_v4_1_0_200510311029 driver:

!MESSAGE IWAT4039E The Test Execution Harness reported the following 
problems:Connection refused on host paules.torolab.ibm.com.

This defect seems to be specific to the reporter's specific machine since 
everything works as designed when launching manual and JUnit test suites 
between Windows XP --> Windows XP and Windows XP --> Linux using both 
the host name and IP address.  Returning as 'works for me' until we see this 
symptom again.

This problem appears to have disappeared using the TPTP_v4_1_0_200511070100 
build, host name of the host in the location artifact and disabling the 
firewall on both the client and server.
